text_cards.caption: NO STALLING
text_cards.description: Captured pieces are placed in a staging area. You may only remove a piece from the staging area if your partner has a piece there.
text_cards.quote: \tiny Patience is not simply the ability to wait - it's how we behave while we're waiting. ---Joyce Meyer

text_cards.caption: TWO FACED
text_cards.description: Rooks may invert after an action. Inverted rooks act like bishops.
text_cards.quote: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another. ---William Shakespeare

text_cards.caption: CROWDSURF
text_cards.description: \NoKing${\Action}^+$: Any non-King piece can crowdsurf.
text_cards.quote: \tiny The joy of surfing is so many things combined, from the physical exertion of it to the challenge of it, to the mental side of the sport. ---Kelly Slater

text_cards.caption: THREE'S A CROWD
text_cards.description: You may not have more that two of any \NoPawn\ on the board, including promoted pieces.
text_cards.quote: Every crowd has a silver lining. ---P.T. Barnum

text_cards.caption: NEAR SWAP
text_cards.description: \NoKing${\Action}^+$: Two adjacent friendly \NoKing\ pieces may swap places.
text_cards.quote: \tiny Would I swap what I have achieved as a cook if I could have been as successful as a footballer? Definitely. ---Gordon Ramsay

text_cards.caption: KNIGHT SWAP
text_cards.description: \NoKing${\Action}^+$: Two friendly \NoKing\ pieces which are a standard knight move apart may swap places.
text_cards.quote: Don't swap horses in crossing a stream. --Abraham Lincoln

text_cards.caption: MAJOR X
text_cards.description: \Sym\KI$\Move^+\Attack^+$: \PM[2,2]
text_cards.quote: Graphic needed.

text_cards.caption: MINOR +
text_cards.description: \Sym\KII$\Move^+\Attack^+$: \PM[0,1]
text_cards.quote: Graphic needed.

text_cards.caption: MAJOR +
text_cards.description: \Sym\KI$\Move^+\Attack^+$: \PM[0,2]
text_cards.quote: Graphic needed.

text_cards.caption: 8x10 BOARD
text_cards.description: The legal playing area includes an additional file on the right and left.
text_cards.quote: The Bureau doesn't have any secret files. ---W. Mark Felt

text_cards.caption: 10x8 BOARD
text_cards.description: Add and additional rank on the top and bottom.
text_cards.quote: \tiny He who joyfully marches to music in rank and file has already earned my contempt. He has been given a large brain by mistake, since for him the spinal cord would suffice. ---Albert Einstein

text_cards.caption: FLOOR IS LAVA
text_cards.description: Pieces ending their turn on the four central squares die. Pieces may move over lava.
text_cards.quote: \tiny Zeal is a volcano, the peak of which the grass of indecisiveness does not grow. ---Khalil Gibran

text_cards.caption: BLOCKADE
text_cards.description: At the end of a Rook action, it may be inverted. Upside-down rooks move normally, but cannot be taken or attack.
text_cards.quote: Everyone thinks at some point if what they are doing has any meaning or not. ---William Macbeth

text_cards.caption: SHOGI PAWN REBELLION
text_cards.description: Pawns take one square forward and may not move two squares initially. No drop restriction.
text_cards.quote: The thing worse than rebellion is the thing that causes rebellion. ---Frederick Douglass

text_cards.caption: RUNAWAYS
text_cards.description: Bishops may also take by retreating.\newline\Bishop$\Attack^+$: \Back\Bishop\Move
text_cards.quote: When danger reared it's ugly head, he bravely turned his tail and fled. ---Sir Robin's minstrel

text_cards.caption: TELEPORTER
text_cards.description: \KII\ may move to any open square adjacent to a friendly pawn.
text_cards.quote: If I could teleport, I'd probably still be late. --Anonymous

text_cards.caption: MAGNETO
text_cards.description: \Bishop\Action: move any friendly piece from one square they can move to to another.\newline\Bishop\Attack:$\varnothing$
text_cards.quote: Mankind has always feared what it doesn't understand. ---Magneto

text_cards.caption: META RULES 2
10x10 BOARD
text_cards.description: The legal playing area now surrounds the board.
text_cards.quote: I don't have anything against walls. You know what it is? I like open spaces. ---Dion Dublin

text_cards.caption: BISHOP CHAMPION
text_cards.description: Bishops may move/take using a 2 square jump in any direction. They may also move/take one square rectilinearly.
\Sym\Bishop\Move\Attack: \PM[0,1], \PM[2,2], \PM[2,0]
text_cards.quote: Every absurdity has a champion to defend it. ---Oliver Goldsmith

text_cards.caption: BISHOP COCHAMPION
text_cards.description: \Sym\Bishop\Move\Attack: \PM[1,1], \PM[2,2], \PM[2,0]
text_cards.quote: Between two evils, I always pick the one I've never tried before. ---Mae West

text_cards.caption: PENALTY BOX
text_cards.description: If an enemy piece captured last turn, you may move it to any empty square.
text_cards.quote: I believe that people would be alive today if there were a death penalty. ---Nancy Reagan

text_cards.caption: MINOR X KNIGHT
text_cards.description: \Sym\Knight$\Move^+\Attack^+$: \PM[1,1]
text_cards.quote: Graphic needed.

text_cards.caption: CAVALRY
text_cards.description: A knight can make two captures in one turn.
text_cards.quote: It's hard to lead a cavalry charge if you think you look funny on a horse. ---Adlai Stevenson

text_cards.caption: DROP DELAY
text_cards.description: You may not use a piece dropped on the previous turn.
text_cards.quote: Itâ€™s easier to cool down a fanatic than to warm up a corpse. ---Michael L. Brown

text_cards.caption: TRADING PLACES
text_cards.description: You may swap the locations of a friendly knight and bishop for your turn.
text_cards.quote: You'll all be very, very sorry. ---Louis Winthorpe

text_cards.caption: CHINESE SHOGI PAWNS
text_cards.description: Pawns take one square forward and move like Chinese checkers. Drop only in file without friendly pawns.
text_cards.quote: If there is mate with a Pawn drop, there is a legal mate too. ---Shogi proverb

text_cards.caption: RETREATER
text_cards.description: Bishops move like a queen, but take by moving away from an adjacent piece.
\Sym\Bishop$\Move$: \Queen\Move\newline\Sym\Bishop$\Attack$: \Back\Queen\Move
text_cards.quote: He who fights and runs away, lives to fight another day. ---Proverb

text_cards.caption: BISHOP LONG LEAPER
text_cards.description: Bishops move like a queen, but take by leaping over a piece.
\Sym\Bishop$\Move$: \Queen\Move\newline\Sym\Bishop$\Attack$: \Jump\Queen\Move
text_cards.quote: That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind. ---Neil Armstrong

text_cards.caption: IT FOLLOWS
text_cards.description: After moving a non-pawn piece, the closest $L_1$ norm pawn to the opponent's king moves one space forward.
text_cards.quote: Love make us poets, and the approach of death should make us philosophers.---George Santayana

text_cards.caption: CROWNED LONG LEAPER
text_cards.description: \Sym\Bishop$\Move$: \Queen\Move\newline\Sym\Bishop$\Attack$: \Jump\Queen\Move\newline\Sym\Bishop$\Attack$: \King\Attack
text_cards.quote: Jump! ---Van Halen

text_cards.caption: CROWNED RETREATER
text_cards.description: \Sym\Bishop$\Move$: \Queen\Move\newline\Sym\Bishop$\Attack$: \Back\Queen\Move\newline\Sym\Bishop$\Attack$: \King\Attack
text_cards.quote: He who fights and runs away, lives to fight another day. ---Proverb

text_cards.caption: SHOGI PAWNS
text_cards.description: Pawns take one square forward and may not move two squares initially. Drop only in file without friendly pawns.
text_cards.quote: If there is mate with a Pawn drop, there is a legal mate too. ---Shogi proverb

text_cards.caption: NIGHT KING QUEEN
text_cards.description: Queens move and take like Knight+King.
\Sym\Queen\Move: (\Knight+\King)\Move\newline\Sym\Queen\Attack: (\Knight+\King)\Attack
text_cards.quote: Night's King was only a man by light of day, Old Nan would always say, but the night was his to rule. ---Brandon Stark

text_cards.caption: CROWNED CASTLE
text_cards.description: \Sym\Rook$\Move^+$: \King\Move\newline\Sym\Rook$\Attack^+$: \King\Attack
text_cards.quote: In the land of the skunks, he who has half a nose is king. ---Chris Farley

text_cards.caption: CROWNED BISHOP
text_cards.description: \Sym\Bishop$\Move^+\Attack^+$: \King\Move\Attack
\Sym\Bishop$\Move^+$: \King\Move\newline\Sym\Bishop$\Attack^+$: \King\Attack
text_cards.quote: In the land of the blind the one-eyed man is king. ---Efren Ramirez

text_cards.caption: NIGHT WIZARD
text_cards.description: \Sym\Knight\Move: ±[1,1],[1,3]\newline \Knight\Attack: \Same
text_cards.quote: Do not meddle in the affairs of Wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger. ---J. R. R. Tolkien

text_cards.caption: GENTLEMEN'S AGREEMENT
text_cards.description: You may not drop for check.
text_cards.quote: A gentleman is simply a patient wolf. ---Lana Turner

text_cards.caption: BIAS
text_cards.description: You may only drop pieces on your color.
text_cards.quote: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.

text_cards.caption: BISHOP-KNIGHT SWAP
text_cards.description: \Sym\Knight\Attack: \Bishop\Attack\newline\Bishop\Attack: \Knight\Attack
text_cards.quote: It's time to bait a trap. ---Katie Reus

text_cards.caption: PRISON BREAK
text_cards.description: \small All knights start off the board in jail. If a bishop moves/attacks, ending on the last rank, knights of the same color are now available to be dropped by the owner.
text_cards.quote: \tiny Preparation can only take you so far. After that, you have to take a few leaps of faith. ---Michael Scofield

text_cards.caption: REARGUARD
text_cards.description: Whenever a Queen moves (not drop), it may summon a pawn to the square behind it.
text_cards.quote: If you think you're going to be a backup, you're going to be a backup. ---Nick Foles

text_cards.caption: UNFAIR
text_cards.description: Deal a card. It only applies to white. Deal a second card. It only applies to black. Deal with it.
text_cards.quote: I know the world isn't fair, but why isn't it ever unfair in my favor? ---Bill Watterson

text_cards.caption: UNFAIR
text_cards.description: Deal a card. It only applies to white. Deal a second card. It only applies to black. Deal with it.
text_cards.quote: I know the world isn't fair, but why isn't it ever unfair in my favor? ---Bill Watterson

text_cards.caption: BRIBE
text_cards.description: On your turn you can do an action by an enemy pawn instead.
text_cards.quote: Never underestimate the effectiveness of a straight cash bribe. ---Claud Cockburn

text_cards.caption: NO CLONING THEOREM
text_cards.description: You cannot act with a non-pawn, non-king, non-knight piece your opponent just used.
If your opponent just moved a bishop, rook or queen, you may not act with a piece of the same type.
text_cards.quote: There should be a list of people who can and cannot clone themselves. ---Ted Danson

text_cards.caption: THE ANTS GO MARCHING
text_cards.description: If a non-pawn action was taken, you must move a pawn one square forward if possible.
text_cards.quote: We are not as strong as we think we are. ---Rich Mullins

text_cards.caption: UNFAIR
text_cards.description: Deal a card. It only applies to white. Deal a second card. It only applies to black. Deal with it.
text_cards.quote: I know the world isn't fair, but why isn't it ever unfair in my favor? ---Bill Watterson

text_cards.caption: META RULES
text_cards.description:
\tiny
\begin{enumerate}[wide=0pt]
\item A piece may take at most one action per turn.
\item A piece acting like a pawn may always use en passant to capture another piece acting like a pawn.
\item A king may only castle when moving as a canonical king.
\item Non-king pieces may never castle.
\item Only the first + is applied.
\item Properties gained on a board are lost when a piece is removed from the board.
\PM[x,y] means all 8 possible variations of changing signs and position.\end{enumerate}

text_cards.caption: CHAIN REACTION
text_cards.description: If a pawn capture is made, another action may be taken with a piece that has not moved yet this turn.
text_cards.quote: We never know which of us will start the chain reaction. But one of us will. ---Colin Beavan

text_cards.caption: STRAIGHT FROM THE HORSE'S MOUTH
text_cards.description: \small After an action, knights may be reoriented to face any of the eight adjacent squares, initially facing forward. Knights may capture pieces on the faced square without moving.
text_cards.quote: \tiny A team of horses cannot overtake a word that has left the mouth. ---Wu Cheng'en

text_cards.caption: ROYAL REVERSE
text_cards.description: Bishops and Rooks may move and take backwards like an Orthodox Queen.
text_cards.quote: To the royal guards of this realm, we are all victims in-waiting. ---Cheshire Cat

text_cards.caption: CONJOINED TWINS
text_cards.description: \small Pieces may move to another friendly piece to form a single, conjoined piece. Conjoined pieces cannot be separated or conjoined futher.
text_cards.quote: \tiny There are two things in life for which we are never truly prepared: twins. ---Josh Billings

text_cards.caption: MOVE SWAP
text_cards.description: Two friendly pieces may swap places if one can move to or take the other.
text_cards.quote: Trading is very competitive and you have to be able to handle getting your butt kicked. ---Paul Tudor Jones

text_cards.caption: CHINESE CHECKERS
text_cards.description: Pawns take normally, but move like Chinese checkers.
text_cards.quote: \tiny The Pentagon banned the army from using Chinese-made berets. In a more veiled slap at the Chinese, the Pentagon also banned any alternative form of checkers. ---Jimmy Fallon

text_cards.caption: MAXIMUM EFFORT
text_cards.description: Pieces must act as far as legally possible.
text_cards.quote: Your crazy matches my crazy. Big time. ---Deadpool

text_cards.caption: PARACHUTE
text_cards.description: You may pick up a friendly piece as a move.
text_cards.quote: Another mode of accumulating power arises from lifting a weight and then allowing it to fall. ---Charles Babbage

text_cards.caption: SIEGE TOWER
text_cards.description: \small A piece may move legally to where there is a rook. It goes on top making a combined piece. The combination acts as the bottom rook. The piece on top can move off as a normal action. Stacks are ok. Multi-color is ok.
text_cards.quote: A siege is an act of war. ---Noam Chomsky

text_cards.caption: FAR MIMIC
text_cards.description: Kings act only as any friendly piece which can move to it. No castling.
text_cards.quote: I've been imitated so well I've heard people copy my mistakes. ---Jimi Hendrix

text_cards.caption: CAMOUFLAGE
text_cards.description: You can move through friendly pieces on your color squares.
text_cards.quote: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth. ---Buddha

text_cards.caption: PRECOCIOUS PAWNS
text_cards.description: Pawns start advanced one rank. Draw another card.
text_cards.quote: Precocious was not the same as smart, much less the same as wise, and the perfect opposite of informed. ---Lionel Shriver

text_cards.caption: CHECKERS
text_cards.description: Pawns move and take like checkers.
text_cards.quote: These guys are playing checkers. I'm out here playing chess. When they figure it out, it's too late. ---Max Holloway

text_cards.caption: BISHOP CHAMELEON
text_cards.description: Bishops move normally, but only takes X as X would take. Bishops attack each other normally.
text_cards.quote: I could spend the rest of my life in copying a chair. ---Alberto Giacometti

text_cards.caption: MOVE TWICE
text_cards.description: Move two different pieces, or any take other action once.
text_cards.quote: When someone says you can't do something, do it twice and take pictures. ---Anonymous

text_cards.caption: TAKE TWICE
text_cards.description: Take with two different pieces, or take any other action once.
text_cards.quote: As long as I breathe, I attack. ---Bernaud Hinault

text_cards.caption: LEND ME YOUR HORSE
text_cards.description: Non-pawn pieces protected by a knight may also move/take like a knight.
text_cards.quote: "You should know better than to mount another's war-horse", I said with a smirk. ---Jessica Leake

text_cards.caption: JEDI KNIGHT
text_cards.description: If you only have one knight on the board, it can also move and take like a Queen.
text_cards.quote: If you strike me down, I shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine. ---Obi-Wan Kenobi

text_cards.caption: BEROLINA PAWNS
text_cards.description: Pawns move diagonally and take forward.
text_cards.quote: Berolina is the female personification of Berlin and the allegorical female figure symbolizing the city. ---Wikipedia

text_cards.caption: FAST PAWNS
text_cards.description: Pawns capture normally, but may move any number of squares forward. Draw another card.
text_cards.quote: In ceremonies of the horsemen, even the pawn must hold a grudge. ---Bob Dylan

text_cards.caption: TALLADEGA KNIGHTS
text_cards.description: Knights on your color may move/take like Rooks. Knights on your opponents colore may move/take like Bishops.
text_cards.quote: If you ain't first, you're last. ---Ricky Bobby

text_cards.caption: TOUCHDOWN
text_cards.description: If your king is on the last rank at the end of your turn, you win.
text_cards.quote: It's one of those things: I would 100 percent pancake a guy and steal his soul over scoring a touchdown. ---George Kittle

text_cards.caption: SUMO KING
text_cards.description: Kings may take normally or shove billiards style. Pieces that fall of the edge die.
text_cards.quote: Good spirit! But you should push an opponent with more force! ---E. Honda

text_cards.caption: ALL PASSANT
text_cards.description: Any piece may capture any piece en passant.
text_cards.quote: You never advance without losing something en passant, and you lose it because you're paying so much attention to the new thing. ---Ninette de Valois

text_cards.caption: SACRIFICE
text_cards.description: You may take your own pieces. Draw another card.
text_cards.quote: You can't achieve anything in life without a small amount of sacrifice. ---Shakira

text_cards.caption: BOUNCE
text_cards.description: The board continues by reflection in the outer ranks and files.
text_cards.quote: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom. ---George S. Patton

text_cards.caption: CYLINDER
text_cards.description: Pieces may move as if the right and left side of the board are adjacent to each other.
text_cards.quote: Everything in nature takes its form from the sphere, the cone and the cylinder. ---Paul Cezanne

text_cards.caption: PROFESSIONAL COURTESY
text_cards.description: Pieces do not attack or capture a piece of the same type. Pawns are not professional.
text_cards.quote: Courtesy is contagious - let's start an epidemic. ---Evan Esar

text_cards.caption: INSANE CYLINDER
text_cards.description: Pieces do not move/take backwards. The top and bottom of the board are considered adjacent.
text_cards.quote: There's a fine line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line. ---Oscar Levant

text_cards.caption: MOVE THROUGH FRIENDLY PIECES
text_cards.description: Friendly pieces do not block movement.
text_cards.quote: True friends stab you in the front. ---Oscar Wilde

text_cards.caption: COMPLICATE
text_cards.description: Deal two more cards.
text_cards.quote: When all else fails, complicate matters. ---Aaron Allston

text_cards.caption: COMPLICATE
text_cards.description: Deal two more cards.
text_cards.quote: Progress is man's ability to complicate simplicity. ---Thor Heyerdahl

text_cards.caption: CHAOS
text_cards.description: Deal three more cards.
text_cards.quote: Life is nothing without a little chaos to make it interesting. ---Amelia Atwater-Rhodes

text_cards.caption: SUPREME SACRIFICE
text_cards.description: You may remove any number of friendly pieces before your turn.
text_cards.quote: The speed of your success is limited only by your dedication and what you're willing to sacrifice. ---Nathan W. Morris

text_cards.caption: EXTINCTION
text_cards.description: You lose if you lose all of any piece.
text_cards.quote: Extinction is the rule. Survival is the exception. ---Carl Sagan

text_cards.caption: MINOR TENET
text_cards.description: Bishops move and take backwards like Knights. Knights move and take backward like Bishops.
text_cards.quote: Bold I'm Fine With. I Thought You Were Gonna Say Nuts. ---Mahir

text_cards.caption: ARCHBISHOP
text_cards.description: Queens move and take like Bishop+Knight. Fairy chess Archbishop.
text_cards.quote: If people want a sense of purpose they should get it from their archbishop. They should certainly not get it from their politicians. ---Harold MacMillan

text_cards.caption: CHANCELLOR
text_cards.description: Queens move and take like Rook+Knight. Fairy chess Chancellor.
text_cards.quote: When I'm stirring a saucepan, I don't say to myself, 'Now the chancellor is stirring a saucepan'. ---Angela Merkel

text_cards.caption: CHINESE CANNON
text_cards.description: A rook takes by throwing a friendly piece so that it jumps the rook in a rook direction.
text_cards.quote: I spend most of my life feeling like I've been shot out of a cannon. ---Molly Ivins

text_cards.caption: ROOK-QUEEN SWAP
text_cards.description: Queens and Rooks move normally, but take like each other.
text_cards.quote: I am definitely the queen. I definitely see myself as the queen. ---Lil' Kim

text_cards.caption: KNIGHT-KING SWAP
text_cards.description: Knights and Kings move/take like each other.
text_cards.quote: If I was King for just one day, I would give it all away. --Thompson Twins

text_cards.caption: KING CHAMELEON
text_cards.description: Kings may also move/take like any piece attacking them.
text_cards.quote: I can kind of be a chameleon. ---Sasha Spielberg

text_cards.caption: SUMMONER
text_cards.description: Bishops may summon a friendly non-King piece to an adjacent square
text_cards.quote: My name is Mortimer Alexander and I am a licensed summoner." "Darn. I'd hoped you were the pizza delivery guy. ---Jana Oliver

text_cards.caption: CLERICAL CLONES
text_cards.description: Bishops may move/take like the last piece the opponent moved.
text_cards.quote: I'm starting to see players copy what I do. I'm flattered. ---Dennis Rodman
